name: Hotel Le Floreal

reviews.text: We are a family of 4. Great wholesome
reviews.title: Very hospitable owners

reviews.text: Breakfast. Clean swimming pool. rooms are clean. Walking distance to some great restaurants. Very friendly service.
reviews.title: Great hotel with fantastic serviceminded personnel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ideal for a short break. Children loved the stay and pool
reviews.title: A GEM!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel for 5 nights with my family. The personnel were very serviceminded and the spirit of the owners were alway there. The breakfast is really nice and if you stay at the ground floor you can get a tray and take the breakfast to you room. The pool is small but always clean and the pool area is ok. I would recommend this hotel if you want to relax and use a location for excursions to Monaco, Nice etc.
reviews.title: Warm welcome in Vence

reviews.text: Arriving in Nice in mid-May, we booked our first night at Hotel Floreal because we like Best Westerns and we enjoy Vence. We ended up staying THREE nights, and we would have liked to stay longer! Laurent and Carole were so pleasant and kind, and extremely helpful in resolving problems with our leased Peugeot. We savored "inspired" cuisine in the restaurant, and Laurent's apple tart was unforgettable! The breakfast buffet was abundant, and featured many delicious items that were "homey," not commercial. As we continued traveling, we realized how special it all was--nothing else came close to breakfast at Hotel Floreal!
reviews.title: Very friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had stayed in this hotel on our last visit to the French Riviera in 2007, and decided to return for three days while we visited some of our favorite museums, even though it was a rather long walk from the good restaurants in the old town.
reviews.title: An unpleasant return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a Superior room.. We were able to park in their limited parking area. When we inquired about Wi-Fi when we checked in, we were told that not all rooms could access it and were given a ground floor room that could, but it was marginal -- sometimes it worked, sometimes it didn't.
reviews.title: Horrible restaurant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We awoke at 5:45 the next morning to a pungent odor of baking, a pleasant odor, but not at 5:45 AM. When I asked for another room for the next two nights, the unpleasant woman (I think she was the owner's daughter) at reception denied that anyone had been baking at that hour. She told me there was no Internet access in the only Superior room we could move to. We could move to a Standard room with Internet, but at the same price -- she had already paid the commission for a Superior room! What arrogance! We moved to the Superior room just to be ornery.
reviews.title: A disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That wasn't the only problem. The ventilation system would emit either freezing air or hot air, so we left it off. The pillows on the bed were terrible -- one seemed to be two small lumpy pillows combined into one big lumpy pillow (see photo) and the other was just lumpy. There were two extra pillows in the closet, but they were also small and lumpy. The pillows in our first Superior room seemed to be foam and were hard as a rock. The shower head pointed straight out and couldn’t be adjusted. Neither room had an outlet for a shaver.
reviews.title: Our Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can be sure we won't be staying at the Floreal on our next visit to Vence!
reviews.title: Nothing fancy,but everything OK

reviews.text: we spent a great time at the Floreal. The staff was always very helpful and tried to fulfill every possible wish. We were staying with a rather big group and everyone was enjoying the hotel. The small garden is charming and we were very happy with the food, especially the very good breakfast.
reviews.title: charming, charmant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived quite late after having driven from Zürich, and the owner was very friendly and welcoming. Our room was very nice, simply furnished but in perfect condition. The location was not far at all from the main road that goes through all the towns along the coast. The breakfast was superb, with everything including eggs and bacon, all included in the price, I had to ask two times because I couldn't believe it. I cannot rate the gardens or the pool, as we went in October. It is also a very quiet location with only a little car noise from the road. We really enjoyed our time there.
reviews.title: a great experience

reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights in January. It is a family run hotel, not part of a chain despite its affiliation with Best Western, and is excellent value for a 3 star. The room was v clean, a decent size, with well equipped bathroom. All the rooms have a small balcony, which you can sit out on, and there is a small garden with sunloungers/tables, and a family size pool -maybe 10m? We didn't use either as it was january.
reviews.title: very good for 3 stars
Nice, friendly service, good but not great
reviews.text: Breakfast was 10 euros - simple but ok -coffee not brilliant though.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Plenty of parking, and it is an easy 5 min walk to centre of Vence.
reviews.title: A very pleasant stay

reviews.text: I only stayed for one night but will definitely go back. The service is friendly - with English spoken with no reluctance (!). The rooms are large and comfortable although aren't exactly modern, hip and trendy if that's what you're looking for. There are nice touches like a fresh plant on the balcony table.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: Breakfast was €12. It's good value for hotel breakfast although arguably no hotels provide good value breakfasts. I liked the selection of breads, cheese, ham etc. Sitting in the conservatory overlooking the swimming pool eating breakfast was a good way to start the day.
reviews.title: Perfect Cycling Base

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking is plentiful and easy. The hotel is approx 5 minutes walk to the edge of town and 10 minutes to one of the main squares.
reviews.title: Great value and welcoming staff.

reviews.text: Hotel Floreal is a perfect base for a cycling holiday/adventure. Located in beautiful Vence, France the hotel is two minutes from the start of the Col de Vence (one of the most majestic roads) or one can ride the other direction towards St. Paul de Vence. The rooms are simple but spacious enough to spread out. The Floreal is not going to be confused for a luxury hotel but it is set in a well landscaped area. The balconies look over a great small park like setting. The breakfast is always very well appointed and offers plenty of choices to start the day. Dinner is also excellent if you have the chance. The hotel is an easy five minute walk to the Casino (market) and another five minutes has one in the historic district of Vence with plenty of dinning options.
reviews.title: Comfort, Value & Magnificent Hosts!

reviews.text: One of the signatures of a stay at the Floreal is the amazing staff. They are ever accommodating, helpful with recommendations, and gracious to all travelers. Their willingness to help makes the Floreal standout.
reviews.title: The best hotel to stay in Vence

description: Quiet hotel with rooms and terrace overlooking the garden. Heated swimming pool, restaurant and barbecue in summer time.
